title.value: Improving the generalizability and robustness of large-scale traffic signal control
title.justification: The title is taken from the provided research paper.
title.quote: Improving the generalizability and robustness of large-scale traffic signal control

extractions.description: This paper focuses on enhancing the robustness and generalizability of reinforcement learning (RL) methods for traffic signal control. By integrating distributional and vanilla reinforcement learning using a policy ensemble (RGLight), it achieves superior performance under different scenarios such as varying traffic patterns and sensor failures. Extensive experiments show its effectiveness compared to state-of-the-art baselines.

type.justification: The study conducts extensive experiments to evaluate the performance of the proposed method (RGLight) and compare it with state-of-the-art baselines under various conditions such as missing data and different traffic regimes.
type.quote: We conduct extensive experiments to compare our approach to multi-agent reinforcement learning and traditional transportation approaches.

name.justification: The research primarily focuses on enhancing reinforcement learning methods for traffic signal control applications.
name.quote: A number of deep reinforcement-learning (RL) approaches propose to control traffic signals.

name.justification: The study builds upon graph convolutional networks and demonstrates their application in traffic signal control.
name.quote: Building upon the state-of-the-art previous model which uses a decentralized approach for large-scale traffic signal control with graph convolutional networks (GCNs).

name.justification: The study proposes a method that combines distributional and vanilla RL through a policy ensemble for better performance.
name.quote: we propose using a combination of distributional and vanilla reinforcement learning through a policy ensemble.

name.justification: The primary application domain of the study is traffic signal control using reinforcement learning methods.
name.quote: We learn a traffic signal control agent based on decentralized independent deep reinforcement learning...

name.justification: The paper introduces and evaluates a new model named RGLight that combines distributional and vanilla reinforcement learning for traffic signal control.
name.quote: In this work, we propose RGLight, a method that can further improve both the robustness and generalizability of traffic-signal controllers compared to previous works.

is_contributed.justification: RGLight is introduced and evaluated as a novel method in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this work, we propose RGLight, a method that can further improve both the robustness and generalizability of traffic-signal controllers compared to previous works.

is_executed.justification: The model was tested extensively as stated in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We conduct extensive experiments to compare our approach to multi-agent reinforcement learning and traditional transportation approaches.

is_compared.justification: The model is compared to several state-of-the-art baselines in various environments.
is_compared.quote: In future work, we plan to study the empirical and theoretical properties of RGLight to model multi-agent systems in other similar domains.

referenced_paper_title.justification: RGLight is a novel contribution and does not reference an external paper specifically by title for its introduction.

name.justification: The paper uses real-world traffic data from Luxembourg to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed model.
name.quote: We use representative traffic data from part of Luxembourg and Manhattan to evaluate the performance of our model in real-world settings.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper for the Luxembourg dataset is mentioned.

name.justification: The paper uses real-world traffic data from Manhattan to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed model.
name.quote: We use representative traffic data from part of Luxembourg and Manhattan to evaluate the performance of our model in real-world settings.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper for the Manhattan dataset is mentioned.

name.justification: The SUMO simulator was used to conduct simulations of urban mobility.
name.quote: We conduct the demand surge experiment in a synthetic network because it is difficult to control the demand parameter in real networks with real traffic demand...All of our studies use the simulation of urban mobility (SUMO).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a specific reference title for the SUMO simulator.
